Job Title: Project Manager/Senior Enterprise Architect - Clearance Required

Location: Scott AFB, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Overview

LMI is seeking a project manager/senior enterprise architect at our client site at Scott AFB. The goal of this project will be to assist the U.S. Transportation Command and its components (Air Mobility Command (AMC) and Military Surface Deployment and Distribution Command (SDDC)) in its enterprise, business and solution architecture goals. Under the guidance of the assigned government lead, this role will accomplish day-to-day task management from key stakeholders. This position will also be in charge of the LMI team as a sub to our prime on this contract.

LMI is a consultancy dedicated to improving the business of government, drawing from deep expertise in advanced analytics, digital services, logistics, and management advisory services. Established as a private, not-for-profit organization in 1961, LMI is a trusted third party to federal civilian and defense agencies, free of commercial and political bias. We operate completely free of political and commercial bias, and we are entirely aligned with the goals of our clients. Our clients value our specialized services in logistics, intelligence, homeland security, health care, and energy and environment markets. We believe government can make a difference, and we seek talented, hardworking people who share that conviction. We offer a generous compensation package with excellent benefits that start the first day of employment. Business casual dress, flex time, and tuition reimbursement are a few of our many work-life benefits available to our employees.

Responsibilities

 Identify and implement best-practice solutions to client requirements  Integrate strategy, business, and technology planning methods with an ability to understand, analyze, justify, and communicate the solution of EA problems.  Provide enterprise, business and solution architecture support to develop and oversee the technical blueprint, assist in the translation of functional capability into the functional and technical architecture for that capability, help lead the definition of the EA framework, and provide governance support over the implementation and management of that framework.  Provides technical knowledge and analysis of highly specialized applications and operational environments, high-level functional systems analysis, design, integration, documentation and implementation advice on exceptionally complex problems that need extensive knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation.  You will also be in charge of of the LMI team. 

Miminim

 Qualifications 

 Bachelors in Computer Sciences, Information Management or related field (Masters Degree in similar field is acceptable substitute)  Must possess an active Secret Clearance, for which you must be a US Citizen  Demonstrated experience with process improvement/process modeling projects  5 or more years experience with architectural frameworks  Ability to organizational mission and strategies to IT solutions  Strong knowledge of DoDAF or FEAC  Familiarity of other architecture modeling techniques and tools  Expertise with Microsoft tools to include MS Visio, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Sharepoint  Working knowledge of Air Mobility Command, its organization, purpose and structure.  Expertise within a mobility environment focused on transportation, communication, command and control, or finance  Proven ability to lead a team including project budgeting and on time deliverables  Experience with modern technologies including AI and MI which the current client is interesting in learning and integrating into its EA capabilities 

Desired

 EA certification (e.g., Enterprise Architecture Certification (CEA), Associate Certified Enterprise Architect (ACEA))  Experience establishing enterprise functional and technical architecture design patterns and technical reference architecture and providing subject matter expertise to implement governance of that framework in the federal space.  Superior written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to compose, write and edit a variety of general business correspondence, management reports, technical presentations, training material, proposals and position papers.  Must be comfortable interacting with key leadership, be articulate, and be proactive.  Must be able to work in a highly charged and fast-paced environment to prioritize and complete assigned tasks based on guidance from senior leadership. Interacts with staff at all levels and across organizational teams.  Masters degree

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
